data.text:
Whenever I tell people I’m done with my National Service, what follows is “WHAT NEXT”??. Sincerely, I don’t know the answer to that. Am I furthering my education or seeking employment??? As a fresh Geomatic engineering graduate, it’s one of the toughest questions I can’t honestly answer even to myself. So I always wonder, if I am to continue with studies what’s my specialization going to be?? Is it GIS, Remote Sensing, Geodesy, Hydrographic Surveying, Carthography, just to mention a few, or I’ll totally divert to another engineering discipline??? And is going to be in the country or overseas and the source for funds to do so???? And with employment, as a fresh graduate with only a year and 6 weeks experience from my National Service and internship program respectively, which organization will be willing to offer me employment as most of the advertisements I have seen have a minimum of 3 years experience. Or am I to gather funds and start a survey engineering firm on my own?? But even so, where will the start up capital be acquired??? As an enthusiastic young engineer with all the wild ideas and thoughts I’m only left to dream about my ways to improve the survey units and practices of the country as a whole. Such as establishing a good Hydrographic unit for tidal readings and sea floor mappings whose data comes in handy during coastal developments. Also, good Astronomical survey unit for constant observation of astronomical features. Not forgetting a good geodetic unit to constantly monitor the survey stations and controls of the country for the necessary readjustments to always improve the accuracy of survey observations been done in the country and to even extend it to the neighbouring African countries with an internationally recognized coordinate system. There are a lot of ideas but one keen aspect is an active cartographic, GIS and remote sensing unit for constant update of the national maps and satellite images of the country and its necessities. As most of the areas still have very old satellite imageries which makes dependency on satellite images for projects at such areas difficult. Dreams will always be dreams but they eventually do come true when greatly persued and eagerly worked towards.

Are you a Junior Engineer and wanting to break into the Earth Observation industry? I speak with a lot of graduates/ junior Earth Observation engineers, so I thought I would share some tips to help you secure an Earth Observation position: 1️⃣ Gain Practical Experience. This could be internships, projects or volunteer opportunities. 2️⃣ Python is widely used for data analysis and processing in Earth Observation. So, make sure you have experience with Python as it will be on the job description as a must have skill. 3️⃣ Stay up to date on Earth Observation news and follow the companies you apply to. 4️⃣ Having a degree in Geography, Environmental Science, Remote Sensing, Climate Science etc. will help. There are also many other degrees that are looked at for Earth observation. 5️⃣ Tailor your CV and Cover Letter. Customise them to reflect the job requirements and highlight your relevant experiences. If you want any more tips comment below for more information. #EarthObservation #RemoteSensing #CareerTips

How will you find opportunities to work in your domain of interest? (For upcoming Geoscientists) 1. First grow interest in your geosciences domain. 2. To all upcoming geoscientists, do literature survey and find out some interesting research topics, make a write up of 2 to 3 pages on your research ideas ( Introduction, research objectives, modification on existing methodology or your innovative approach to fulfill the research objectives, what type of data is required and how to get access of those data, workflow and conclusions). 3. Make a CV of maximum two pages 4. Then search for internships throughout the world in both industry and academia and apply for internship along with your cv and research write up. 5. Before apply, study well and practice some coding inline with your research objectives. 6. Grow interest in research atleast in the pre-final Year of your course if not earlier. 7. Please try to apply atleast 2 internships everyday. 8. And make a strong determination, believe in yourself. You can do it and you must make it successful. Just start the first step, then you can achieve it automatically. Hopefully, you will get an opportunity to work in your domain. #oilandgasindustry #geophysics #geology #reservoir #earthsciences #iits #ism
